docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THEY ARE the children of the children of the 60's, growing up in an age when much of what seemed outrageous then is commonplace. Yet in many ways, today's teen-agers are having to sort through an ambiguous and contested legacy. The sexual revolution in America bequeathed them a social code that is explicit yet no longer liberated, and an atmosphere in which adolescents are scrutinized more publicly than ever before, yet given little guidance by the adults they must answer to.

headline.main: The Teen Years: Time of Mixed Messages
